resources.string: Show your EU Digital COVID Certificates from your smartphone with ease.
Your data is stored in one place: locally on your smartphone. You decide when you show your data and who you show it to.
Step one: upload your EU Digital COVID Certificate to your smartphone

Use the CovPass app to scan the EU Digital COVID Certificate for a Covid-19 vaccination or recovery from a Covid-19 infection. To do this, hold your smartphone’s camera above the QR code. Your EU Digital COVID Certificate will be transferred to your smartphone immediately.
Step two: open the QR code in the CovPass app

Using the QR code, you can show evidence of a Covid-19 vaccination or recovery from a Covid-19 infection. The QR code is displayed directly in the CovPass app after scanning it. Please be aware that a vaccination only becomes sufficiently effective about 14 days after the final dose. For this reason, the QR code for full vaccination only becomes valid after 14 days have passed.
Step three: show your QR code when needed

You can show your QR code from the CovPass app when you need it. The person checking the QR code will then scan it. You will also need to have an ID document at hand for this. Your QR code is stored only on your smartphone, so you can display it at any time even without an internet connection.
Using the CovPass app is voluntary. You can also use the digital COVID Certificates in paper form.

To protect against forged certificates or manipulation, the digital COVID Certificates are electronically signed by the RKI. For this purpose, the necessary data is transmitted once in encrypted form to the RKI. Once the digital COVID Certificate has been created, the RKI will immediately and permanently delete the data. The QR code contains the information from the digital COVID Certificate, and the RKI’s electronic signature, in encoded form.

When you present the QR code of a certificate in the app for verification, others will be able to find out whether you have tested negative, are fully vaccinated, or have proof that you have recovered from a coronavirus infection. During verification, the official verification app will also display the name and date of birth. In the case of test certificates, the date of sampling will also be displayed.
The digital COVID Certificates are only stored on your smartphone. You have the possibility to delete the digital COVID Certificates at any time.
Detailed information about this data processing is available in the privacy notice:
Terms of Use for US citizens
If you are a US citizen, these Terms of Use apply to the App:
Would you like to update the CovPass app now?
There is news about your certificates
Please check the status of your EU Digital COVID Certificates.
The view \"New features\" has been opened
The view \"New domestic rules\" has been opened
Are your certificates valid in Germany?
Illustration of two people in a checking situation. One person is scanning the certificate of another person. The EU flag is depicted above it.
When your certificates are checked within Germany, stricter rules sometimes apply than when traveling within the EU.

For example, certificates of recovery are valid for a shorter period in Germany than in the EU. In addition, a single vaccination with Johnson & Johnson no longer counts as complete basic immunization.\n\nFrom now on, you can preview whether your certificates are valid in Germany according to the domestic rules under \"Check validity\" on the start screen.
The start screen has been opened
EU Digital COVID Certificates. Sensible health data will follow. Please take care that nobody listens to or reads on your smartphone.
You do not have any EU Digital COVID Certificate saved at the moment. Tap the button \"Add a certificate\" (plus symbol) to add a Digital COVID Certificate.
Black QR code on white background
This QR code can be reliably verified with the CovPassCheck app.

Please insist to have your certificate scanned with the CovPassCheck app. Only by scanning your QR code and showing your proof of identity the validity of your vaccination protection can be checked reliably while protecting your data.
Do you work in a restaurant or at events? Check your customers’ certificates with ease:
The view \"Please scan!\" has been opened
The view \"Scan QR code\" has been opened
The view \"Scan QR code\" has been closed
The view \"Are you authorized?\" has been opened
Image: Two people are facing each other. One person shows her smartphone with a QR code. The other person scans the QR code and sees a green check mark.

Please make sure that you are authorized to add the certificate of another person, e.g. for your children or relatives. You can find more information in the #Frequently Asked Questions::https://www.digitaler-impfnachweis-app.de/en/faq#.\n\n Do you only want to check the validity? Please use the #CovPassCheck app::https://apps.apple.com/en/app/covpass-check/id1566140314# for that.

Please make sure that you are authorized to add the certificate of another person, e.g. for your children or relatives. You can find more information in the #Frequently Asked Questions::https://www.digitaler-impfnachweis-app.de/en/faq#.\n\n Do you only want to check the validity? Please use the #CovPassCheck app::https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.rki.covpass.checkapp# for that.

To prevent misuse, certificates from a maximum of 20 different people can be added.\n\nThe CovPass app is not suitable for checking third-party certificates. Use only the CovPassCheck app for verification.
Image: Person holds smartphone over three different certificates with QR code
Your smartphone is not protected by a code
The CovPass app saves sensitive data to your smartphone. To protect your data against access by strangers, we recommend that you set up an unlock code for your smartphone.
In the following step, scan the QR code from an EU COVID digital certificate or upload it as a photo or PDF file. The certificate will then be loaded directly into the CovPass app.

The CovPass app uses your smartphone’s camera to scan QR codes.\n\nYour camera is only ever accessed while you use the app and only with your permission. You have the option to change this permission in your smartphone’s settings at any time.
The view \"Camera access needed\" has been opened
Camera has been opened. The QR code will be scanned automatically.
The CovPass app wants to access your camera.
Allow access to scan QR codes.
This test certificate cannot be added
The Covid-19 test certificate that you have scanned does not show a negative test result. The current version of the CovPass app can only save negative Covid-19 test results.

The CovPass app must be able to access your photo gallery temporarily in order for you to import a photo.\n\nAccess to your photos is only granted during the import process and only with your permission. You have the option to change the permission at any time in the settings of your smartphone.
Check whether there is a QR code in the selected file.
Note that certificates cannot be imported if they are revoked, invalid or already stored in the app.
Take a screenshot of the QR code in question and import it again as a photo.
Click to select or deselect all certificates.
You can now continue to use your certificate(s) as usual.

You can store certificates of up to 20 people in the app. The import exceeds this maximum number of people. Please adjust the selected file or delete certificates already imported into the app that are no longer needed.
The file could not be read
The selected file may be corrupted, or password protected. Please select another file.
Always display this person\'s certificates in first place: active
Always display this person\'s certificates in first place: not active
Results of the EU certificate examination
The view \"Check validity\" has been opened
The view \"Check validity\" has been closed
The view \"Choose destination\" has been opened
The view \"Choose destination\" has been closed
The view \"Select date\" has been opened
The view \"Select date\" has been closed
The view \"Select time\" has been opened
The view \"Select time\" has been closed
Check beforehand if your certificates are valid in different countries. This tool checks them against the travel regulations applicable in your chosen destination country.
Rules of entry not up to date
The rules of entry are updated in the app every 24 hours. Unfortunately, the last update failed. Make sure your smartphone is connected to the internet and try again.
A validity check of your currently saved certificates is unfortunately not possible.
Unfortunately, not all certificates can be checked!
Unfortunately, a validity check is not possible for some of your saved certificates. These will be excluded from the check.

Is your destination not listed? More countries are progressively being added in stages. \n\nYou can find more information in the frequently asked questions and at #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.
Confirm date and continue to time selection
Please check the validity of your certificates.
One or multiple certificates are expired, or will expire soon.
You have not saved any certificates yet
Add a certificate so you can check its validity.
Different rules apply within Germany than for entry into Germany. You can change your selection above.

Please be aware that travel regulations can change. You should check your certificates at least 48 hours before you travel. Different regulations or restrictions might apply in some regions or when you return. You might also need additional documents to travel to a different country. \n\nYou can find more information in the frequently asked questions and at #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.
EU Digital COVID Certificate of Vaccination
EU Digital COVID Vaccination Certificates. Sensible health data will follow. Please take care that nobody listens to or reads on your Smartphone.

Das Impfzertifikat gilt innerhalb der EU als gültiger Nachweis für Reisen. Die Mitgliedsländer haben unterschiedliche Einreisebedingungen. Mehr Informationen finden Sie in den Häufigen Fragen. Bitte informieren Sie sich vor Reiseantritt über die am Zielort geltenden Gesundheitsmaßnahmen und entsprechenden Beschränkungen.\n\nInformationen über die in den jeweiligen EU-Ländern geltenden Einreisebestimmungen finden Sie unter #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.

A certificate of vaccination is valid proof for travel within the EU. The EU’s member countries have different travel restrictions. You can find more information in the Frequently Asked Questions. Before travelling, please check the applicable public health measures and related restrictions applied at the point of destination.\n\nPlease inform yourself about the public-health measures and corresponding restrictions at your travel destination before you travel. You can find information about the travel restrictions applicable in each EU country at #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.
EU Digital COVID Test Certificates. Sensible health data will follow. Please take care that nobody listens to or reads on your smartphone.
You can only download German certificates as PDF documents

Das Testzertifikat gilt innerhalb der EU als gültiger Nachweis für Reisen. Die Mitgliedsländer haben unterschiedliche Einreisebedingungen. Mehr Informationen finden Sie in den Häufigen Fragen. Bitte informieren Sie sich vor Reiseantritt über die am Zielort geltenden Gesundheitsmaßnahmen und entsprechenden Beschränkungen.\n\nInformationen über die in den jeweiligen EU-Ländern geltenden Einreisebestimmungen finden Sie unter #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.

A test certificate is valid proof for travel within the EU. The EU’s member countries have different travel restrictions. You can find more information in the Frequently Asked Questions. Before travelling, please check the applicable public health measures and related restrictions applied at the point of destination.\n\nPlease inform yourself about the public-health measures and corresponding restrictions at your travel destination before you travel. You can find information about the travel restrictions applicable in each EU country at #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.
EU Digital COVID Certificate of Recovery
EU Digital COVID Certificate of Recovery. Sensible health data will follow. Please take care that nobody listens to or reads on your Smartphone.

Das Genesenenzertifikat gilt innerhalb der EU als gültiger Nachweis für Reisen. Die Mitgliedsländer haben unterschiedliche Einreisebedingungen. Mehr Informationen finden Sie in den Häufigen Fragen. Bitte informieren Sie sich vor Reiseantritt über die am Zielort geltenden Gesundheitsmaßnahmen und entsprechenden Beschränkungen.\n\nInformationen über die in den jeweiligen EU-Ländern geltenden Einreisebestimmungen finden Sie unter #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.

A certificate of recovery is valid proof for travel within the EU. The EU’s member countries have different travel restrictions. You can find more information in the Frequently Asked Questions. Before travelling, please check the applicable public health measures and related restrictions applied at the point of destination.\n\nPlease inform yourself about the public-health measures and corresponding restrictions at your travel destination before you travel. You can find information about the travel restrictions applicable in each EU country at #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.

For the selected country and date, there are currently no entry rules available to check for in the App. \n\nPlease check at #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu# whether the certificate is valid for entry into the selected country.
This certificate is valid on your travel date
%d rules of the destination country were successfully checked.
There are currently no entry rules available for this certificate type and the selected country and date. Please note the following:
This certificate cannot be completely verified.
Sorry, an automatic check is not possible for this certificate. Please review the information marked out below yourself.
Rule at destination: antigen tests are valid for a maximum of 48 hours.
This certificate is invalid on your travel date
Rule at destination: recovery certificates are valid for up to 180 days.
This value is to be checked
Please connect to the internet to check a certificate’s validity.
Turn off Airplane Mode or use Wi-Fi to access data
Always display this person\'s certificates in first place: active
Always display this person\'s certificates in first place: not active
You are not fully vaccinated. To use this QR code as proof of completed vaccination, you will need to add another vaccine dose.
You are not yet considered fully vaccinated. Full vaccination takes effect 14 days after the final dose.
This QR code can be reliably verified with the CovPassCheck app.
Show this QR code when needed. Be ready to show ID when your QR code is checked.
Please find more information in our #Frequently Asked Questions::https://www.digitaler-impfnachweis-app.de/en/faq#.
Show this QR code when needed. Be ready to show ID when your QR code is checked.
Show this QR code when needed. Be ready to show ID when your QR code is checked.
Show this QR code when needed. Be ready to show ID when your QR code is checked.

The expiry date of your latest certificate has passed. You can conveniently renew this certificate in the CovPass app. Previous certificates will not be renewed. To do so, use the renewal function in the overview of your certificates or scan a newly issued certificate.
Your latest certificate was not issued in Germany and therefore cannot be renewed in the app. Please contact the issuer of the certificate.

You can easily renew your latest certificate in the CovPass app. Previous certificates will not be renewed. To do so, use the renewal function in the overview of your certificates or scan a newly issued certificate.
The certificate has been recalled by the issuing authority. Please make every effort to have a new digital certificate issued.
Standardisierter Name, Vorname / Standardized name, first name
Check vaccination status. Sensible health data will follow. Please take care that nobody can listen to or read on your smartphone.
Do not show this sensitive data to other people in restaurants, at events or in similar situations. Always have your QR code checked with the CovPassCheck app.
EU Digital COVID Certificate of Vaccination
EU Digital COVID Certificate of Vaccination. Sensible health data will follow. Please take care that nobody listens to or reads on your smartphone.
This certificate is for a vaccine that only requires one dose or a vaccine for people who have recovered from an infection and only need one dose.
Standardisierter Name, Vorname / Standardized name, first name
Datum der Impfung / Date of vaccination (YYYY-MM-DD)
Technical expiry date / Technical expiry date
You will be notified in the app if you can renew the certificate.

Diese Bescheinigung ist kein Reisedokument. Die wissenschaftlichen Erkenntnisse zu COVID-19 in den Bereichen Impfung, Testung und Genesung entwickeln sich fortlaufend weiter, auch im Hinblick auf neue besorgniserregende Virusvarianten. Bitte informieren Sie sich vor Reiseantritt über die am Zielort geltenden Gesundheitsmaßnahmen und entsprechenden Beschränkungen.\n\nInformationen über die in den jeweiligen EU-Ländern geltenden Einreisebestimmungen finden Sie unter #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.

This certificate is not a travel document. The scientific findings about Covid-19 and vaccination, testing and recovery are continuing to evolve, which includes findings about new, concerning virus variants. \n\nPlease inform yourself about the public-health measures and corresponding restrictions at your travel destination before you travel. You can find information about the travel restrictions applicable in each EU country at #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.
You can only download German certificates as PDF files.
EU Digital COVID Certificate of Test
EU Digital COVID Test Certificate. Sensible health data will follow. Please take care that nobody listens to or reads on your smartphone.
Standardisierter Name, Vorname / Standardized name, first name
Art des Tests / Type of test
Datum und Uhrzeit der Probenahme / Date and time of sample (YYYY-MM-DD, HH:MM)
Testzentrum oder -einrichtung / Testing centre or facility
Land der Testung / Country performing test
Technical expiry date / Technical expiry date
You will be notified in the app if you can renew the certificate.

Diese Bescheinigung ist kein Reisedokument. Die wissenschaftlichen Erkenntnisse zu COVID-19 in den Bereichen Impfung, Testung und Genesung entwickeln sich fortlaufend weiter, auch im Hinblick auf neue besorgniserregende Virusvarianten. Bitte informieren Sie sich vor Reiseantritt über die am Zielort geltenden Gesundheitsmaßnahmen und entsprechenden Beschränkungen.\n\nInformationen über die in den jeweiligen EU-Ländern geltenden Einreisebestimmungen finden Sie unter #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.

This certificate is not a travel document. The scientific findings about Covid-19 and vaccination, testing and recovery are continuing to evolve, which includes findings about new, concerning virus variants. \n\nPlease inform yourself about the public-health measures and corresponding restrictions at your travel destination before you travel. You can find information about the travel restrictions applicable in each EU country at #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.
EU Digital COVID Certificate of Recovery
EU Digital COVID Certificate of Recovery. Sensible health data will follow. Please take care that nobody listens to or reads on your smartphone.
Standardisierter Name, Vorname / Standardized name, first name
Krankheit oder Erreger, von dem die Bürgerin oder der Bürger genesen ist / Disease or pathogen that this person has recovered from
Disease or pathogen that this person has recovered from
Datum des ersten positiven Testergebnisses / Date of first positive test result (YYYY-MM-DD)
Date of first positive test result (Year-Month-Day)
Land der Testung / Country performing test
Zertifikat gültig ab / Certificate valid from (YYYY-MM-DD)
Zertifikat gültig bis (höchstens 180 Tage ab dem Datum des ersten positiven Testergebnisses) / Certificate valid until (maximum 180 days after the date of the first positive test result)(YYYY-MM-DD)
Certificate valid until (maximum 180 days after the date of the first positive test result)(Year-Month-Day)
Technical expiry date / Technical expiry date
You will be notified in the app if you can renew the certificate.

Diese Bescheinigung ist kein Reisedokument. Die wissenschaftlichen Erkenntnisse zu COVID-19 in den Bereichen Impfung, Testung und Genesung entwickeln sich fortlaufend weiter, auch im Hinblick auf neue besorgniserregende Virusvarianten. Bitte informieren Sie sich vor Reiseantritt über die am Zielort geltenden Gesundheitsmaßnahmen und entsprechenden Beschränkungen.\n\nInformationen über die in den jeweiligen EU-Ländern geltenden Einreisebestimmungen finden Sie unter #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.

This certificate is not a travel document. The scientific findings about Covid-19 and vaccination, testing and recovery are continuing to evolve, which includes findings about new, concerning virus variants. \n\nPlease inform yourself about the public-health measures and corresponding restrictions at your travel destination before you travel. You can find information about the travel restrictions applicable in each EU country at #https://reopen.europa.eu::https://reopen.europa.eu#.
You can only download German vaccination and recovery certificates as PDF files.

If this is your latest certificate, you can renew it on the overview of your certificates. You cannot renew previous certificates. Your latest certificate contains all the necessary information for a check.
This certificate was not issued in Germany and therefore cannot be renewed in the app. Please contact the issuer of the certificate.
The certificate has been recalled by the issuing authority. Please make every effort to have a new digital certificate issued.

If this is your latest certificate, you can renew it on the overview of your certificates. Otherwise, you don\'t have to do anything because your latest certificate contains all the necessary information for a check.
The view \"Create EU printout\" has been opened
You can save the certificate as a PDF document. Saving is voluntary. Initially, only you have access to the PDF document.
Please note that the PDF document contains sensitive information. We recommend that you handle it with care and only show it to people you trust and who are authorised to check the proof.
We recommend that you do not publish the PDF document and do not send it by email or share it via other apps.
Do you really want to delete this COVID certificate?
The data will be permanently erased from this device. It will not be possible to recover the data.
The EU Digital COVID Certificate has successfully been removed from this device.
An unexpected error has occurred. Please try again later.
There was an error while trying to connect to the internet. Please check your internet connection.
The scanned QR code could not be recognized as an EU COVID certificate or as a proof for ticket bookings. Please scan a suitable QR code.
The current version of the app you are using does not support this data format. Please check if you have installed the latest version of the app available from the app store on your smartphone.
COVID certificate does not have a valid signature
This certificate might have been issued by an unauthorised organisation or the app might not have been updated. For the latter, please connect to the internet and try again later.
Check the validity of your certificates
If you can renew this certificate in the app, you will receive a notification. You can find more information about replacing expired certificates in our FAQs.
The COVID certificate you have scanned is already in the app. You may potentially have scanned this COVID certificate twice.
The view \"Update checking rules\" has been opened
The view \"Update checking rules\" has been closed
The view \"Open-source licences\" has been opened
The view \"update notifications\" has been opened
The view \"update notifications\" has been closed
Here you can find all legal information and answers to the most frequent questions asked about the CovPass app.
Contact for technical questions about the CovPass app
The app uses the following open-source libraries:

To check the validity of certificates, the app requires up-to-date lists of trusted certificate issuers as well as the current Covid-19 rules in the relevant travel countries.\n\nThese lists are updated automatically on a daily basis. You can also manually update them here at any time.

You can now disable the update notifications. You can use the toggle to disable or re-enable the updates at any time. If you disable the update screen, you will no longer receive updates about the latest software developments in the app.
Do not show this type of notifications anymore
You can change this option anytime in the settings.
Share your certificates for booking purposes
The provider wants to ensure that a valid certificate is available for your booking. Your consent is required for the provider to retrieve your booking details and release your stored certificates.
By tapping on “Accept”, you consent to the following steps:

The app will retrieve from the provider %s the name and date of birth of the person specified at the time of booking, the booking details relevant to the verification (e.g. destination country and date of travel) and the certificate requirements specified by the provider for your booking.
Once retrieved, the app will use this data to determine which of your stored certificates can be used
You are not obliged to allow your certificate to be verified with the CovPass app. There are other ways to prove that you have been vaccinated, tested negative or recovered from coronavirus.
The requirements for the certificate are set by the provider. The RKI has no influence on this. Please contact the provider for more information about the certificate requirements.
The determination of suitable certificates takes place locally on your smartphone. No data will be transmitted to the RKI or the provider.
The RKI does not receive the information about your booking or about the certificates you have stored.
Detailed information about this data processing is available in the privacy notice:
The provider \"%s\" is not known to us. If you proceed, please check the origin of the QR code and make sure you want to submit your certificate to the provider.
The name of the provider should be familiar to you.
The name of the provider should match the name on the booking portal.
If you have any doubts about the seriousness of the provider, it is better to cancel the process.
If you have any further questions, please contact the provider.
The \"Release certificates for booking purposes\" view has been opened.
The \"Release certificates for booking purposes\" view has been closed.
Your certificate must meet the following requirements:
The \"Select certificate\" view has been opened.
The \"Select certificate\" view has been closed.
No certificate matches the above requirements.
Please check if your certificate stored in the app matches the requirements.
The selected certificate and your booking data will now be transmitted to the provider\'s verification partner. Your consent is required for the transmission of your data to the verification service.
By tapping on “Accept”, you consent to the transfer of the following data to the verification partner of %s:
Content and electronic signature of the selected certificate (including name and date of birth of the certificate holder, validity period, issuer and date of issue, vaccine/test/recovery details).
The booking details retrieved from the provider %s:
Period during which the certificate must be valid (travel duration or event date)
For travel bookings: Country of origin and country of destination or journey
For cross-border travel: Certificate requirements imposed by the destination country
Further certificate requirements on the part of the provider (e.g. which vaccines or test procedures are accepted)

The verification partner will check whether the electronic signature is genuine and that the technical expiration date has not passed. You can view the technical expiration date and the transmitted certificate contents in the app when viewing the certificate in full.
The certificates contain sensitive data concerning health. You should therefore only allow providers to verify certificates if you know and trust them.

The RKI is not responsible for the data processing performed by the provider and the verification partner. Please read their privacy notices so that you know what your data is used for and how it is used.
The verification partner will immediately inform the provider of the result of this verification. The only information communicated will be whether the verification was successful or not.
Detailed information about this data processing is available in the privacy notice:
The \"Submitting your certificate for verification\" view has been opened.
The \"Submitting your certificate for verification\" view has been closed.
Certificate meets the requirements of the provider
If you have any questions, please contact the provider %s.
Unfortunately, an automatic check is not possible. Please check the information marked in yellow yourself.\n\nIf you have any questions, please contact the provider %s.
Certificate does not meet the requirements of the provider
The information that does not meet the requirements is marked in red below.\n\nIf you have any questions, please contact the provider %s.
The scanned QR code is not valid for this booking. Please check if the QR code is intended for the CovPass app.\n\nYou can find more information in the Frequently Asked Questions.
The identity of the provider could not be verified
Unfortunately, an error occurred while verifying the identity of the provider %s. Please try again later.
The identity of the test partner could not be verified

The booking portal suggests sharing your certificate with the following validation partner: %s. We do not know this validation partner.\n\nFor a list of supported validation partners, see the Frequently Asked Questions.
The identity of the validation partner could not be verified
Unfortunately, an error occurred while verifying the identity of the validation partner. Please try again later.
The booking data could not be retrieved
Unfortunately, an error occurred while loading the booking data. Please try again later.
The booking data could not be processed
Unfortunately, an error occurred while processing the booking data. Please try again later.
Could not connect to the provider
Check if your smartphone is connected to the Internet and try again.
The certificate could not be verified
Unfortunately, the verification could not be completed successfully. Possible reasons can be found in the Frequently Asked Questions. Please try again at a later time.
The certificate could not be submitted for validation
Unfortunately, the verification could not be submitted to the validation partner. Possible reasons can be found in the Frequently Asked Questions. Please try again at a later time.
Do you really want to end the process?

The EU specifications for certain vaccination certificates have been changed. This certificate does not correspond to the current numbering. It is still valid. However, if it is a certificate for a booster vaccination, it will not be recognized as such when checked.\n\nTherefore we recommend requesting a new certificate with the number 2/1 directly free of charge via the app.
The process is uncomplicated and takes only a few minutes. You can trigger the renewal also later on the overview of your certificates.
Consent to transmitting your certificates to the RKI
By clicking \"Agree\" you agree to the following steps:
The app transmits the vaccination certificate to the RKI.
The RKI checks/verifies the certificate, issues an updated certificate and transmits it to the app.
To ensure that certificates can only be updated to a limited extent, the identifier of the old certificate is documented by the RKI.
The renewal of the certificate is voluntary and free of charge.
Detailed information on data processing can be found in the privacy policy:
Your new certificate completely replaces the previous one. You can delete the old certificate now.

Unfortunately, there was a problem reissuing your certificate. Please check your internet connection. Note that the certificate can be reissued a maximum of three times a year. For more information on the error code below please contact our hotline at 0800–4747–001 or support\@covpass-app.de.\n\nError code: %s
The technical validity of your vaccination certificate is about to expire or has already expired. Renew the certificate to continue using it.
The technical validity of your recovery certificate is about to expire or has already expired. Renew the certificate to continue using it.
The app transmits the aforementioned certificates to the RKI for verification.
The RKI checks the certificates, issues a renewed certificate and transmits it to your app.
The renewal of certificates is voluntary and free of charge.

To ensure that certificates can only be updated to a limited extent, the identifier of the old certificate is documented by the RKI. The other data on your certificates will be deleted by the RKI immediately after renewal.
When renewing certificates of family members, please ensure that the person concerned agrees.

In certain cases, additional certificates are sent in addition to the certificate to be renewed. This is necessary in order to be able to include the previous sequence of vaccinations and recoveries in the new certificate.
You can now continue to use your certificate as usual.
The certificate you scanned was revoked by the RKI due to an official decree.
The certificate was revoked by the certificate issuer due to an official decision.
The certificate you scanned was revoked by the RKI due to an official decree. Please make every effort to have a new digital certificate issued.
The validity of a certificate has changed. This certificate can no longer be used for verification.
The validity of a certificate has changed. This certificate can no longer be used for verification. Please make every effort to have a new digital certificate issued.
The RKI has revoked the certificate due to an official decree.
The certificate was revoked by the certificate issuer due to an official decision.
The RKI has revoked the certificate due to an official decree. Please make every effort to have a new digital certificate issued.
